p: The probability of disease transmission in the event of sexual contact between an infectious and susceptible individual depends on gender and choice status. Risk can be greatly reduced through condom use, or increased by engaging in dry or anal sex [ 16â€“ 18]. Those who are choice disabled are less likely able to chose safer sex practices. Similarly, the total number of sexual contacts may depend on choice status as those who are choice disabled may not be able to chose their number of sexual contacts as they would wish.
